body.name: Evenflo GoTime LX Booster Car Seat (Astro Blue)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Thursday, February 22. Order within 22 hrs 35 mins
features: BOOST YOUR SAFETY QUOTIENT: Features a deep design with overlapping head and body sides, providing added support where it’s needed most; meets or exceeds all applicable federal safety standards
MAKE ADJUSTMENTS WITH EASE: Allows for easy height adjustment to 7 positions with one hand for better fit for your child as they grow
SMOOTH THE TRANSITION: Offers two modes of use, easily transitioning from high back to no back booster for kids at least 4 years of age, weighing 40 to 120 lb
JUST GET UP AND GROW: Allows you to keep your growing child in the booster longer, adjusting as needed to maintain proper vehicle belt fit
KEEP BEVERAGES HANDY: Features 2 cup holders built into the seat, keeping drinks and snacks close and allowing the driver to stay focused on the road
body.description: When your child is finally old enough to get up and go with a little more ease, the Evenflo GoTime LX Booster Seat gets them to their next adventure with safety, comfort and style. Designed to accommodate children from 40 to 120 lb, 44 in to 57 in., and a minimum of 4 years of age, the GoTime LX is designed for older kids who could use an extra boost for safer seating in the vehicle. Offering two modes of forward-facing use and 7 height positions, you can easily adjust the height with just one hand to find the perfect fit for your growing child. Deep design with overlapping head and body sides keeps your child supported. Once they’re ready, the back quickly removes for a no back booster. The included belt clip helps properly position the vehicle’s belt on the child’s shoulder. Dual-integrated cup holders keep snacks and drinks close by, allowing you to stay focused on the road while driving. The padded seat adds comfort on long road trips, and is removable and machine-washable for easy cleaning. Comes in a choice of fun colors and patterns to let your child’s individuality shine. If you need help installing your car seat, our ParentLink® customer service experts offer help online in real time. Get live video support with a certified car seat safety technician to assist with proper vehicle installation, so you can drive with confidence. It's been 100 years and Evenflo continues to push the boundaries in baby and children’s gear design and innovation. We meet the needs of new generations of parents by focusing on what they really care about: leading-edge safety, smart design and technology, and convenient features that help them enjoy the journey of parenthood.

productInformation.name: Care instructions
productInformation.value: ‎Read all instructions and warnings on the product, product labels, and instruction manuals before use. Consult your vehicle owner's manual to determine proper placement of child restraint in your vehicle and familiarize yourself with your vehicle's components.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars From 5 point harness to high back booster
reviews.reviewText: So I will start this by saying this is for my daughter, which is my first kid. So this is the very first time I have changed my kid from a 5 point harness car seat to a high back booster seat. I was excited to make the switch. But I was not prepared. So we got it delivered, and I watched my husband put it together, which was very easy. And then he struggled figuring out how to put the padding on, so I took over and did that part. The first thing I noticed is how flimsy it is. But didn’t want to judge it until it was all the way out together. So I got the padding all on and in place, then had my daughter come sit in it (in the livingroom) so I could she how she looked in it. As soon as she sat down I had to have her get up and sit it against the wall so she could sit in. It, because again, it was VERY flimsy. I told my husband I wasn’t sure about it, that yeah, the lightweight-ness of it is nice if you are switching between cars or will be taking it in and out of the car. But I rather it be heavy & feel more solid/stable/durable than I care about the weight of the seat. So the next day, we took it out to the car to get it in & ready to leave for an appointment. I did not prepare myself from going from a seat that is anchored in, and a 5 point harness around my kid, holding her in place and felt very secure and protected, to her basically just having a regular seat belt & that’s it. So the shock of that, making me feel like something wasn’t right, that she needed to be hooked in more/better, made me dislike it even more. Now if it anchored into the car, that may help my dislike, or if it were a heavier less flimsy seat, that may change my dislike for it. I had this one and a graco seat picked out, & let my daughter pick between the two. She picked the “pink” one. The graco one was just black grey & white so I assumed she’d like the one with colors on it. Now for my moms car (she babysits) I picked the graco seat. And I 100% regret getting this one as the Graco seat is much better quality I feel. Again, the seat may be perfect for someone else, this is just how it felt and is for me. & I’m a Graco mama at heart, so I am a little biased. As far as being a high back booster seat, as far as making my child the correct height and position for the seat belt, it does it’s job there. I just hope that until I am able to order the graco seat, we are not involved in any wrecks to truly put it to the test. Because I’m not to confident in it. In the meantime, we just haven’t been going anywhere unless absolutely necessary due to this.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Grandson Loves It
reviews.reviewText: I Let my grandson pick out his own booster and he loves this one. He can get in and buckle himself in with no help. Makes him feel grownup! He also picked it out because he wanted 'Army" design on it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good car seat for the money.
reviews.reviewText: When I first put it in my car for my great grandson, we had the back on. He asked to have the back removed because he said it hurt his stomach where the belt laid across it with the back on. I do think it's safer with the back on, since it would protect the head much better. Regardless, it's easy for the kids to sit down and strap in. The car seat was easy to put together. It was also easy to adjust the back to have the head positioned where you need it. It's also easy to take the back off and put it back on if wanted.

reviews.reviewTitle: A little hard to assemble in a pinch
reviews.reviewText: This was the best purchase when my relatives would be charged so much more to bring with them on a flight!
My grandson loved this product . Loves his booster seat with head rest and cup holders .A true hit

Bought for my small vehicle so my kids have more room for their legs, compared to their bulky car seats. The size is good for a smaller vehicle. They are easy to switch from car to car. However the cushioning doesn’t stay on at all, it moves all over and constantly comes off.Overall a fine booster, but could be better.
You get what you pay for. It's very cheap quality. The fabric would not stay in place on the head rest. Didn't feel safe. We ended up returning it.
